p: A maximum-likelihood phylogenetic tree was constructed from pol and env gene sequences using recombination-free datasets generated in RDP4 ( Martin et al. 2015). This analysis was conducted using an Subtree pruning and regrafting (SPR) branch-swapping heuristic search in PhyML 3.0 ( Guindon et al. 2010) and 1, 000 bootstrap replicates were used to estimate node robustness in the phylogeny. As part of this analysis, we specified the smart nucleotide selection model ( Lefort, Longueville, and Gascuel 2017), which identified GTR + Γ4 model of nucleotide substitution model as most appropriate for this dataset. Using this tree, we performed a linear regression of root-to-tip divergences using the TempEst routine to check for temporal signal in the FFV sequences ( Rambaut et al. 2016).
